ai.susi.mind

Class SusiAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • ai.susi.mind.SusiAction

  • public class SusiAction
extends java.lang.Object
    An action is an application on the information deduced during inferences on mind states as they are represented in an argument. If we want to produce respond sentences or if we want to visualize deduces data as a graph or in a picture, thats an action.

    • Method Detail

      • answerAction

        public static JSONObject answerAction(java.lang.String[] answers)
        answer action: produces a written or spoken answer. If several answers are given one of then can be picked by random by the client.
        Parameters:
        answers -
        Returns:
        the action

      • tableAction

        public static JSONObject tableAction(JSONObject cols)
        table action: to draw a table. The columns of the table must be selected and named
        Parameters:
        cols - a mapping from column names in th data object to the display names for the client rendering
        Returns:
        the action

      • piechartAction

        public static JSONObject piechartAction(int total,
                                        java.lang.String keyName,
                                        java.lang.String valueDescription,
                                        java.lang.String valueUnit)
        piechart action: draw a pie chart
        Parameters:
        total - the total count of the sum of all pie shares, i.e. 100 if the shares are percent values
        keyName - the key name of the data column which points to the values
        valueDescription - a descriptive naming of the values
        valueUnit - the unit of the values, i.e. "%"
        Returns:
        the action

      • rssAction

        public static JSONObject rssAction(java.lang.String titleName,
                                   java.lang.String descriptionName,
                                   java.lang.String linkName)
        rss action: draw a search result-like list. The client must show this in the same way as a websearch type action would do
        Parameters:
        titleName - the name of the title column
        descriptionName - the name of the description column
        linkName - the name of the link column
        Returns:
        the action

      • websearchAction

        public static JSONObject websearchAction(java.lang.String query)
        websearch action: draw a search result list. This must look the same as the rss action
        Parameters:
        query - the search query
        Returns:
        the action

        public static JSONObject anchorAction(java.lang.String link,

        Parameters:
        link - the link
        text - the anchor text
        Returns:
        the action

      • mapAction

        public static JSONObject mapAction(double latitude,
                                   double longitude,
                                   int zoom)
        map action: draw a map for a given location and zoom level. The location is the center of the map. The client should draw a marker on the map at the given location.
        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        zoom - zoom level, same as for openstreetmap
        Returns:
        the action

      • getRenderType

        public SusiAction.RenderType getRenderType()
        Get the render type. That can be used to filter specific information from the action JSON object to create specific activities like 'saying' a sentence, painting a graph and so on.
        Returns:
        the action type

      • execution

        public SusiAction execution(SusiArgument thoughts,
                            SusiMind mind,
                            java.lang.String client)
        Action descriptions are templates for data content. Strings may refer to arguments from a thought deduction using variable templates. I.e. "$name$" inside an action string would refer to an data entity in an thought argument which has the name "name". Applying the Action to a thought will instantiate such variable templates and produces a new String attribute named "expression"
        Parameters:
        thoughts - an argument from previously applied inferences
        Returns:
        the action with the attribute "expression" instantiated by unification of the thought with the action

      • toJSONClone

        public JSONObject toJSONClone()
        An action is backed with a JSON data structure. That can be retrieved here.
        Returns:
        the json structure of the action

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        return the json representation of the object as a string
